title: Genital wart
summary: Genital warts are a sexually transmitted infection caused by certain types of human papillomavirus (HPV).[4] They are generally pink in color and project out from the surface of the skin.[1] Usually they cause few symptoms, but can occasionally be painful.[3] Typically they appear one to eight months following exposure.[2] Warts are the most easily recognized symptom of genital HPV infection.[2]
